q: 2001 I never imagined-even in my wildest dreams-that we would get as far, as fast as we have today,'' Mr. Eric Schmidt said in a post on the Official Google Inc. Blog. Search has quite literally changed people's lives-increasing the collective sum of the world's knowledge and revolutionizing advertising in the process. And our emerging businesses-display, Android, YouTube and Chrome-are on fire. Of course, like any successful organization we've had our fair share of good luck, but the entire team-now over 24,000 Googlers globally-deserves most of the credit. Google Inc. 's co-founders brought in Mr. Eric Schmidt , a trained computer scientist, to shepherd the young company along in the early days of the dot-com boom and eventually he helped take Google Inc. public in 2004. is 11 weeks long and teams are matched head-to-head while also accumulating overall points. There is also a fake budget of$ 1,000 to spend on acquiring free agent players through a wavier system. It's a blind draw. You put a price on a player that nobody else can see and at 6 p.m. on Friday nights when the waiver period is up, it goes to the highest bidder, Tony Windis said. Tony Windis lost his starting quarterback in Kevin Kolb during the first quarter of the first week, and it turned into a blessing in disguise when he made his move to acquire Michael Vick

less interested in any reconnection with Jay Leno . His relationship with David Letterman remains unaffected- his Late Night predecessor apparently called him over the holidays.`` It was just a quick call,'' Conan O'Brien qualifies. We hadn't spoken for a long time, and David Letterman just called to basically say, you know,' I haven't checked in on you. I just wanted to make sure that we were good.' And I said,` We've always been good.' I have a lot of respect for that guy. It was not a lengthy phone call. He's not a blabbermouth, but it was nice. It was just nice to get the call. A reconciliation with Jay Leno , though, seems highly unlikely.`` I don't think so,'' Conan O'Brien concedes.`` I mean, I think we all know what... you know. There's

CBS News reports that Dodge-Chrysler is seriously rethinking minivans as an automotive form factor, and that the company plans to completely redesign the iconic American family hauler. We need to seriously rethink the minivan, said Sergio Marchionne , CEO of Chrysler, in a recent ABC interview.`` We need to retain all its functionality but make it much more versatile. Strong words from the company the popularized the minivan concept

and religious liberty have forgotten the lessons of history,'' said Rep. Mike Pence , R-Ind., at the Family Research Council's 2010 Values Voter Summit. Former Arkansas Mike Huckabee , at the same summit, said: We need to understand there is a direct correlation between the stability of families and the stability of our economy.... The real reason we have poverty is we have a breakdown of the basic family structure. And Sen. Jim DeMint , R-S.C., said:`` It's impossible to be a fiscal conservative unless you're a social conservative because of the high cost of a dysfunctional society.'' Those are reasonable concerns
